definition:
Given an edge $xy$ of a graph $G$, the graph $G/xy$ is obtained from $G$
by *contracting* the edge $xy$; that is, to get $G/xy$ we identify the
vertices $x$ and $y$ and remove all loops and duplicate edges. A graph
$G'$ obtained by a sequence of edge-contractions is said to be a
*contraction* of $G$.
